intro: Allosorus myriophyllus var. clevelandii, commonly known as Cleveland's allosorus, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of California. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its unique leaf morphology and growth habits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands or chaparral. Its leaves are often clustered at the base, with a striking coloration that can range from green to reddish hues. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
